definition: as if relieved from a burden (idiom)/to have a weight off one's mind
to explain/to release/Buddha (abbr. for 釋迦牟尼|释迦牟尼[Shi4 jia1 mou2 ni2])/Buddhism
to bear/to carry (on one's back)/to turn one's back on/to be defeated/negative (math. etc)

sentences.english: It was with immense relief that just before 1am we finally chugged back into life.
sentences.chinese: 在凌晨1點之前火車終於開了，我們如釋重負。

sentences.english: I have a sense of completion.
sentences.chinese: 我有一總如釋重負的感覺。

sentences.english: When Japan occupied Nanjing, they were relieved and went back home.
sentences.chinese: 當日軍佔領南京的時候，他們才如釋重負並回到家裏。

sentences.english: Finally midnight arrived, he breathed a sigh of relief and went home.
sentences.chinese: 終於午夜到了，他如釋重負地長舒了一口氣回家了。

sentences.english: Hearing the news, he breathed a sigh of relief.
sentences.chinese: 一聽到消息，他如釋重負地鬆了口氣。

sentences.english: I walked downstairs and drove to the office.
sentences.chinese: 我如釋重負地走下樓回到辦公室。

sentences.english: Victories by one-goal margins always bring a sense of relief.
sentences.chinese: 雖然以一球淨勝，但是它帶來了如釋重負的感覺。

sentences.english: But I was only relieved to have my burden removed, if only temporarily.
sentences.chinese: 但是我僅僅感覺如釋重負，好像僅僅也是臨時的。

sentences.english: Behind me I could hear the other girls sigh in relief.
sentences.chinese: 我能聽到身後其他幾個女孩如釋重負地鬆了口氣。

sentences.english: In his farewell address the Lord Jesus put the disciples' minds at ease.
sentences.chinese: 幸好主耶穌的臨別贈言，令門徒如釋重負。

sentences.english: Mr. Buffett’s report was greeted with sighs of relief among some shareholders.
sentences.chinese: 巴菲特的報告受到了一些股東的如釋重負的嘆息。

sentences.english: He immediately turned the cab around and returned the child to her relieved family.
sentences.chinese: 他立刻把計程車調頭，把小孩還給如釋重負的家人。

sentences.english: What she felt most deeply is a sense of great relaxation.
sentences.chinese: 傑米森說她停經時的最深感受是如釋重負。

sentences.english: He disburdened by confessing his sins.
